name: Homewood Suites by Hilton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for just one night, but look forward to staying again in the future. The hotel staff greeted us with a smile and were very friendly and eager to make sure our stay was comfortable.
reviews.title: Great Stay, Clean Space, Good Food, Friendly Staff

reviews.text: Our room was spacious, clean and had a great aroma. This is the perfect place for a long weekend or any kind of extended stay. There is a full kitchen, with a full-size refrigerator as well as a stove, dishwasher--everything you would need to prepare and store a meal. There is even a dining room table. Also, the free breakfast buffet was fabulous!
reviews.title: Great Property at a Great Rate

reviews.text: Of course, the flat screen TV, super clean and comfy bedding, spacious bathroom with walk in shower and all of the other extras (sofa, desk and chair, free Wi-Fi)....make this a must stay destination if you're ever in Waco, Texas.
reviews.title: Very nice suite hotel in Waco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whenever we travel in the future, I will search for a Homewood Suites in whatever city we visit. They've set a new standard!
reviews.title: Excellent 24 hours!

reviews.text: A newer Homewood Suites that does it all correctly. If your travels bring you to Waco, strongly recommend this wonderful hotel. Great rooms, good shower water pressure, decent WiFi speed, typical HS breakfast, great location & even HD sets with HD channels. Of course the local HD channels were a bit hidden, but luckily the channel listing guide is prominently situated close by. My only issue was there were a few noises most likely coming from the suite above me, but not too distracting.
reviews.title: Customer Service Lacking

reviews.text: Wow, really really nice. A bit off the beaten path and a tad expensive (it was the holidays though) for Waco. I am a big fan of Hiltons and will start looking more for Homewood Suites. Big and roomy.
reviews.title: Super!

reviews.text: The moment we arrived, the manager visited with us as he carried our bags to our suite.
reviews.title: Loved this place!

reviews.text: He invited us to have Rotisserie chicken and macaroni and cheese.....they serve dinner (free) during the weekdays in addition to breakfast! We already had dinner plans, but walked through just to observe....rolls, green beans, chicken, mac and cheese...all looked yummy!
reviews.title: Nice room for price

reviews.text: I did go to breakfast the next morning. Eggs, sausage, bacon-hot breakfast provided as well as fruit, cereal, coffee, yogurt. The common area has a beautiful fireplace that I enjoyed.
reviews.title: Even Better Than Expected
Very nice
reviews.text: The suite was perfect for our weekend....flat screen TV that rotated to view from sofa or bed, complete with DVD player. The kitchenette was cozy, we made microwave popcorn (provided) and used the wine opener. There were essentials...plates, glasses, pots, etc .
I really thought this was a classy place..... Way more than I expected for $119.00.
reviews.title: Really beautiful.... More than I expected.

reviews.text: Everything at this hotel is great. The staff knew my name day 1 and called me by name the rest of the week. They offer not only a great breakfast but great complimentary food and drinks after work.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in.

reviews.text: What a great stay. We stayed here a week for business trip to Waco. This had everything you needed- free wifi, along with complimentary breakfasts and dinners. Below is the breakdown:
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: Perfect! Great sized room that was very clean. We did not hear any "hall noise." We did have one issue with the TV not coming on in the bedroom our first night there. We called the front desk and they had someone up that fixed it within 5 minutes. I was wowed, because this was a Sunday evening & I didn't figure anyone would be available to fix it till Monday.
reviews.title: Wonderful with minor problems

reviews.text: Cleanliness: This is one area I am big on and I was very pleased. All areas of this hotel- grounds, room, eating areas were spotless.
reviews.title: Everything a business traveler needs

reviews.text: Hard to find; hard to get to; pretty isolated from everything. But the hotel is well run and the staff is helpful. We were just stopping by for one evening, but we enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: Good night

reviews.text: We stopped here on our way to Dallas. This staff was very accomodating. The room, which includes a living area, kitchenette, and bedroom was perfect. Plenty of room to spread out. The price is in line with most major chains. Breakfast in the a.m included scrambled eggs, waffles, bacon, juices etc. This was all included in the price of the room. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: The Homewood Suites by Hilton in Waco offers a pleasant place to settle in for a brief stay. While the business is located adjacent to I-35, and you can see the highway flyover from the window, traffic is inaudible in the room. Unfortunately, my upstairs neighbor's every move is audible. The only other disappointment is that there is not a "full kitchen." There is no oven. If you were staying without a car, you might also be disappointed that you cannot walk to drugstores or grocery stores. Nonetheless, you can walk to Chuy's and the Hillcrest Hospital. There is a walking trail that encircles two ponds with fountains. Let me list the other pluses: friendly staff, immediate attention to guest requests, spotless room, neutral and appealing decor, comfortable bed, attractive bath, interior corridors, free parking, free wi-fi. In terms of suite size, this room is smaller than a Best Western Premier suite I had in Lancaster, PA, and an extended stay suite I once had in Phoenix, AZ. I haven't viewed the laundry facility but should note there is not a washer and dryer in the room. My trip to Baylor University is only ten minutes by car, and this location is also ten minutes from the Waco mall. I am always looking for a place to stay that has a bedroom that can achieve total darkness. Sadly, I didn't find that feature--light comes into the room from the top of the window treatments. Nonetheless, I will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: At Home in Waco

reviews.text: Mr. Kary H. Lalaini and his staff are true professionals. Their customer service is excellent. As soon as I approached the front desk, I was warmly welcomed and my reservation was timely. My room was clean, open, and the complimentary breakfast and dinner are over the top! The fitness center is clean and I love the free weights and machines. This is the only hotel my family and I will stay when we conduct business in Waco.
reviews.title: The best hotel in Waco!

reviews.text: The Homewood Suites by Hilton in Waco, TX is a phenomenal hotel experience. Large, clean rooms, complimentary breakfast and dinner, secure facilities, and a hospitable staff make this hotel the Waldorf Astoria of Waco, TX. I’ve stayed at this hotel over 100 nights, and I’ve never had a negative experience.
reviews.title: Home away from home

description: The Homewood Suites by Hilton in Waco, TX is Central Texas' newest all-suite up-scale hotel. Located at the intersection of I-35 and Highway 6 in the new Legends Crossing mix use development, the property overlooks beautiful Legend Lake and is adjacent to the new Hillcrest Baptist Medical Center and across the street from Chuy's. The all-suite hotel features 88 total suites each including spacious studio, one- and/or two-bedroom suites feature separate living and sleeping areas. Each has a fully-equipped kitchen with full size refrigerator, microwave, 2-burner stove and dishwasher.
